properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 13 at 10:05AM CST until February 14 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Bitter Cold Wind Chills through Tonight...

.Accumulating snow has ended over the area, but strong northwest
winds, blowing snow and bitter cold temperatures will continue
this morning. The bitter cold air will remain over the region
tonight, leading to wind chills as low as 20 to 25 below into
Friday morning.

Many untreated roads this will remain snow and ice covered this
morning due to the overnight snowfall and drifting snow.
Scattered flurries will continue along with pockets of blowing and
drifting snow.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25
below zero.

* WHERE...Portions of east central Iowa and northwest Illinois.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 10 AM CST Friday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Many roads will remain slick this morning
due to the overnight snowfall and continued drifting snow.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM CST THIS MORNING
